text: The 2019 Charleston Southern Buccaneers football team represented Charleston Southern University in the 2019 NCAA Division I FCS football season. They were led by first-year head coach Autry Denson and played their home games at Buccaneer Field. They were members of the Big South Conference. They finished the season 6–6, 4–2 in Big South play to finish in third place. ==Previous season== The Buccaneers finished the 2018 season 5–6, 3–2 in Big South play to finish in third place. ==Preseason== ===Big South poll=== In the Big South preseason poll released on July 21, 2019, the Buccaneers were predicted to finish in third place. {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || Kennesaw State || 134 (14) |- align="center" | 2 || Monmouth || 122 (5) |- align="center" | 3 || Charleston Southern || 79 (1) |- align="center" | 4 || Campbell || 73 |- align="center" | 5 || Gardner–Webb || 67 |- align="center" | 6 || Hampton || 64 |- align="center" | 7 || Presbyterian || 21 |- align="center" | — || North Alabama || |} ===Preseason All–Big South team=== The Buccaneers had three players selected to the preseason all-Big South team. Offense Zack Evans – OL Defense J.D.
